_header: Most goodly fair as list it you to hear
Title(s): His Mistress the Keeper of his Heart
_description:
His Mistress the Keeper of his Heart, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 15) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and 4-line Envoy (abab)

BLHar682.First Lines:
MOst goodly fayre as lust hit yow to hereAs in what wise y kepe in
                    gret cherte…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Which shett is in ioy or aduersiteWithin the cofre of my
                    remembraunce
